column4: morning folks.  I have a quick question, does anyone here use the Cinammon desktop environment?
really?  it has a PPA and such, and te cinammon website has a Ubuntu download section
I was mostly looking to find out how to install something from a PPA.  I think i added the PPA correctly, and ran sudo apt-get update
but past that...i have no idea what to do -_-'
make sure the ppa has packages for your ubuntu version
it does
how did you add it?
also can you point out the ppa link so I can look?
sudo add-apt-repository ppa:gwendal-lebihan-dev/cinnamon-stable
and you can find it at...
thanks I can find it from that
ok, cool.  I'm brand new to all this
which ubuntu version are you on?
alright, looks like it is there, how about: apt-cache policy cinnamon
what are you looking for with that command?
Candidate: some_version_here with a ppa url below
cinnamon:
Installed: (none)
Candidate: 1.6.1-0ubuntu1~precise1
Version table:
1.6.1-0ubuntu1~precise1 0
500 http://ppa.launchpad.net/gwendal-lebihan-dev/cinnamon-stable/ubuntu/ precise/main i386 Packages
yep that looks fine, remember pastebin in the future, I imagine you would just: sudo apt-get install cinnamon; but I have never used the software myself
